rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE IN {0085, 0124, 0125, 1015, 1376, 1377, 2241, 2350, 3251, 3255, 3273, 3280, 3281, 3282, 3834, 3879, 4527, 4638, 4647, 4648, 4649, 4650, 4651} Do true Otherwise Any co-req unit set {ECSYSENG01, ECSYSENG02, ENG-ECS, ENG-MCTRN, MECHATRN01, MECHATRN02}

description: Students will be introduced to the fundamentals of linear electronic circuit analysis and design. At the completion of the unit students will develop skills in using state of the art prototyping and measurement tools for linear electronic circuit analysis and design. The topics covered in this course include, sinusoidal steady-state analysis using phasors and complex impedances, feedback concepts, solid-state electronics, solid-state diodes and diode circuits, field-effect transistors, bipolar junction transistors and single-transistor amplifiers.
